intro: Trigonotis vestita, commonly known as the silverleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray leaves and bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice among gardeners.
